definitions.definition: a piece of something hard or solid, usually without a particular shape

examples.text: This sauce has lumps in it.
He put a few more lumps of coal on the fire.

definitions.definition: a small cube of sugar, used in cups of tea or coffee
a swelling (= an area that is larger and rounder than normal) under the skin, sometimes a sign of serious illness

examples.text: He was unhurt apart from a lump on his head.
Check your breasts for lumps every month.
He's developed a painful lump on his neck.
She felt a lump in her breast.
Surgeons operated to remove the lump.
Tests confirmed the lump was cancerous.

definitions.definition: a heavy, lazy or stupid person

examples.text: Come on, you big lump—time to get up.

definitions.definition: to feel pressure in the throat because you are very angry or emotional
to accept bad things that happen to you without complaining

examples.text: We made mistakes but we took our lumps.

wordOrigin: noun Middle English: perhaps from a Germanic base meaning ‘shapeless piece’; compare with Danish lump ‘lump’, Norwegian and Swedish dialect lump ‘block, log’, and Dutch lomp ‘rag’.
